result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler James Schafer

03:08 PM Defendant Tyler James Schafer in court with attorney Chad M Fahrenkrug, via zoom.  Defendant Tyler James Schafer in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tyler James Schafer appeared by video means with Attorney, via zoom.  Atty Fahrenkrug has copy of complaint, waives reading and enters Not Guilty plea and reserve rights.  Court receives Not Guilty plea.  Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Tyler James Schafer
Current: 1601 10th Ave Trailer D24, Antigo, WI 54409 United States  (Effective: 03-08-2022)
Prior: 239540 Nolan Road, Aniwa, WI 54408

01:20 PM Defendant Tyler James Schafer in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tyler James Schafer appeared by video means, via zoom.   Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. doesn't know RE; counsel.  Court questions def. on attorney rights.  Def. wants to represent himself.  Court questions def.  Court will not consider waiver of atty rights and advise def. to contact P.D. State gives bail/bond recommendation. Def. is on a probation hold.  Court orders $500.00 Signature bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
